trans-unit.source: Adapts a Web page for a specific browser and provides the base class from which all page adapters inherit, directly or indirectly.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class is an abstract class that adapts a Web page for a specific class of browsers, defined by the markup language that the browser uses (for example, HTML or XHTML).

Much of the adaptability in rendering behavior can be encapsulated in the specialized text writer classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class, so it is not always necessary to provide a page adapter.
Most members of derived page adapters are called from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or from control adapters.

First, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or control adapters detect the presence of the derived page adapter, and then call the member, or provide the functionality if the page adapter is not present.
The members of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByParams%2A> properties define additional HTTP headers and HTTP `GET` and `POST` parameters that can be used to vary caching.
They are called during cache initialization from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method returns an object that can be used to persist the combined view and control states of the page.
It is referenced from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.PageStatePersister%2A> property if a derived page adapter is present.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetPostBackFormReference%2A> method provides a DHTML code fragment that can be used to reference forms in scripts.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method returns a collection of the postback variables if the page is in postback.
It is called by the .NET Framework instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.DeterminePostBackMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method if a derived page adapter is present.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderEndHyperlink%2A> methods are used by control adapters to render hyperlinks if a derived page adapter is present.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method renders a hyperlink or postback client tag that can submit the form.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetRadioButtonsByGroup%2A> methods are used by radio button control adapters to reference the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.ClientState%2A> property provides access to the combined control and view states of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object through the internal `ClientState` property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> method is used by control adapters to perform device-specific text transformation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter"></xref> class.
The .NET Framework constructs this adapter internally when it creates the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or derived class.
Gets a list of additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied for the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
Entities on the Web that cache Web pages cache multiple versions, based on the HTTP headers and other factors.
For example, a version for each language in which a page is generated is typically cached, based on the `Accept-Language` HTTP header.
For specific browsers, it might be necessary to vary caching by HTTP headers in addition to the headers that control target-independent caching.
For example, it might be necessary to cache different versions of a page for different screen sizes.
The header names returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> property are added to the list of headers on the `Vary` HTTP header sent to the client browser.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> that contains a list of HTTP headers; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a list of additional parameters from HTTP GET and POST requests by which caching is varied for the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
Entities on the Web that cache Web pages cache multiple versions based on, among other factors, the request parameters.
For example, a version for each store location within a retail chain for which a page might be generated would typically be cached based on the parameter name (for example, `StoreID`).
For specific browsers, it might be necessary to vary caching by GET or POST parameters in addition to the parameters that control target-independent caching.
For example, it might be necessary to cache different versions of a page for different mobile phone service providers.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> that contains a list of the GET and POST parameters; otherwise, `null`.
Gets an encoded string that contains the view and control states data of the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.ClientState%2A> property provides access to the internal `ClientState` property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.

View state data stored by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> object in the internal `ClientState` property of <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> will always be saved in the hidden field on the Web page.
An encoded <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the combined view and control states of the controls on the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
Determines whether the Web page is in postback and returns a name/value collection of the postback variables.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method returns one of the following collections:
Form variables if the HTTP data transfer method is `POST`.
Query string variables if the HTTP method is `GET`.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> of the postback variables, if any; otherwise `null`.
Returns a name-value collection of data that was posted to the page using either a POST or a GET command, without performing ASP.NET request validation on the request.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UnvalidatedRequestValues> class.
The unvalidated form data.
Returns a DHTML code fragment that the client browser can use to reference the form on the page that was posted.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetPostBackFormReference%2A> method provides a DHTML reference to the postback form.
The code fragment has the following format:
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the client ID of the form that was posted.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> with a reference to the form on the page that was posted.
Retrieves a collection of radio button controls specified by groupName.

Radio button control adapters use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetRadioButtonsByGroup%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> methods to reference the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in the group.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that is the name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> group to retrieve.
An of controls that make up groupName.
Returns an object that is used by the Web page to maintain the control and view states.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.PageStatePersister%2A> property uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method to return the object, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class, that forms and extracts the combined control and view states for the page.
If there is no derived page adapter attached to the page, a <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister> object is used to maintain the state in a hidden field on the page.
Link type
Resulting link
Code Entity Reference,cer
Code Entity Reference Qualified, cerq
Code Entity Reference Specific,cers
Code Entity Reference Qualified Specific, cerqs

An object derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister"></xref> that supports creating and extracting the combined control and view states for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
Adds a radio button control to the collection for a specified radio button group.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> object to maintain a list of radio button groups.
Each element in <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> is a collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control to the appropriate collection, creating the collection if it does not already exist, and creating <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> if there are no previously registered <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls.

Radio button control adapters use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetRadioButtonsByGroup%2A> methods to reference the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> to add to the collection.
Renders an opening hyperlink tag that includes the target URL to the response stream.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method writes an opening hyperlink tag.
When `writer` is <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter>, this tag has the following format:
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> containing methods to render the target-specific output.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the target URL of the link.
`true` to use <xref href="System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode(System.String)"></xref> to encode the stream output; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to use as a soft key label.
Renders an opening hyperlink tag that includes the target URL and an access key to the response stream.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method writes an opening hyperlink tag.
When `writer` is an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object, this tag has the following format:
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> containing methods to render the target-specific output.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the target URL of the link.
`true` to use <xref href="System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode(System.String)"></xref> to encode the stream output; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to use as a soft key label.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to assign to the `accessKey` attribute of the link to create.
accessKey is longer than one character.
Renders a closing hyperlink tag to the response stream.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderEndHyperlink%2A> method writes a closing hyperlink tag.
When the text writer is an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object, this tag has the following format:
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains methods to render the target-specific output.
Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded and possibly encrypted view state, and event target and argument.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> containing methods to render the target-specific output.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the postback event target name.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the argument to pass to the postback target event.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to use as a soft key label.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value of the text to display as the link.
Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded and possibly encrypted view state, an event target and argument, a previous-page parameter, and an access key.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink, including the possibly chunked <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.UrlEncode%2A> view state, `__EVENTTARGET=target`, `__EVENTARGUMENT=argument`, `__PREVIOUSPAGE=currentFilePath` parameters, and an `accessKey="accessKey"` attribute.

View state is encrypted if the `enableViewStateMac` attribute of the [pages Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4123bb66-3fe4-4d62-b70e-33758656b458) configuration element is set to `true`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> containing methods to render the target-specific output.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the postback event target name.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the argument to pass to the postback target event.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to use as a soft key label.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value of the text to display as the link.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the URL target page of the postback.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value used to assign to the `accessKey` attribute of the created link.
Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded view state, an event target and argument, a previous-page parameter, and an access key.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink, including the possibly chunked <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.UrlEncode%2A> view state, `__EVENTTARGET=target`, `__EVENTARGUMENT=argument`, `__PREVIOUSPAGE=currentFilePath` parameters, and an `accessKey="accessKey"` attribute.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> containing methods to render the target-specific output.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the postback event target name.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the argument to pass to the postback target event.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to use as a soft key label.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value of the text to display as the link.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value holding the URL target page of the postback.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to assign to the `accessKey` attribute of the created link.
`true` to use & as the URL parameter separator; `false` to use &.
Transforms text for the target browser.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> method can be used, for example, to transform tab characters (`\t`) into line breaks (`\n`).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> base method returns `text` unchanged.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that is the text to transform.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the transformed text.
